ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was a fun course, taught us lots about sustainability and what we can learn from Germany's innovations and technologies.
Speaking skills, essay writing, research using German sources, better understanding of sustainability and Germany's role

I learned a lot about environmental policy and culture in Germany, and we spent a lot of time comparing their solutions to the state of climate and infrastructure investment in the US. I also was able to practice my German and learn more specific vocab in the context of environmentalism.
I learned about a wide variety of aspects concerning sustainability. It was interesting to learn about them from a non-American-centric perspective.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was a classic example of you get out what you put in, and overall I really enjoyed it. Marion was a great instructor and the class really came together so we could learn from each other.

Great way to maintain German and learn new vocabulary as an L5 student
Manageable workload
This course was very flexible in terms of its structure, and we had a lot of input towards learning more about topics that we were personally interested in. It was well taught and interesting.
One of the strengths is that the instructor incorporated student input into the types of assignments and content.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it's a fun German class where you can learn lots about sustainability in America and Germany whilst improving your German at the same time.

Yes! Dr. Gehlker is very nice and is very understanding/flexible with deadlines and assignments. If you have a good idea of things you would like to learn coming into the course, she can point you towards some good resources.
For students with an interest in the environment and adequate German language skills, I would definitely recommend it.
